这是一个热情好客的农场主在自家农场对抗四个邪恶偷电贼的游戏，农场主看见别人来自己家里偷电不仅没有生气还拿自己的棍子给偷电贼捶背，孩子累了就把他抱到树上休息，但是邪恶的偷电贼不仅不领情还偷走农场里的东西，让我们给与农场主力量打败偷电贼吧！！！

Dead By Daylight is often weird, slippery, janky, inefficient, unintuitive, incomplete, and greasy. It's also [i]fun[/i].

This 4v1 horror-themed slasher simulator has taken up great amounts of my time because at the end of the day, it is hugely entertaining. Playing as a Survivor is suspenseful, strategic, and also provides moments of downtime to enjoy chatting with friends or soak up the atmosphere of the environments. Playing as a Killer is hectic, immersive, challenging and very rewarding. 

While some matches can feel unfair and out of your hands, they are the minority. Dead by Daylight isn't a game that works best when everyone is trying their very hardest to win; That's why there's no real 'ranked' mode included in the game. DBD works best when everyone is simply trying to entertain and challenge eachother. This game feels very gratifying to get better and better at, as long as you don't take it [i]too[/i] seriously.

This game is updated extremely frequently, with four major updates releasing every year, with new characters and abilities every single update. As a result of this, content often feels janky and a bit unfinished. This is a shame, but it doesn't render the game noticeably any less fun. Whether the quantity of content makes up for the wavering quality is subjective. I personally love seeing the developers' ideas and attempts to freshen up the game and add new themes, so for me it does.

Play this game to have fun, especially with friends. DBD is also great for people who can't really handle traditional horror games; There are less scares and you have your teammates to help you.

you'll have a miserable time. might take a week, might take a month, might take years, but it's similar to league in the sense that the only reward for continuing to play well is genuine, unfiltered suffering right up until the point where you're in the top .1% of players, and by this point it's already too late to sink 7000 hours into the game before it dies or gets booted off steam cause of nfts. just don't. they'll be better isometric chase games at some point, just like how there will be more MOBAs produced by decent developers. it's tempting, but you'll get facecamped, you'll face up against survivors who do nothing but run perks designed to make them uncounterable and lose the game in 2 minutes, you'll find hackers, you'll find people who DC or kill themselves immediately on hook or actively sabotage you, matchmaking will place you with people at complete random so not even the higher skill level of survivor or lower of killer will be safe. this will be, generously, about 95% of your games. and you'll want those 5% where you actually have a lot of fun. you'll want it so bad. but it's not worth it.
